column2: "I keep asking that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ
column4: may *give NAMES the Spirit of wisdom and revelation*
column5: so that they may know Him better. I pray also that the eyes of their hearts may be enlightened in order *that NAMES may know the hope to which He has called them*
column6: the riches of His glorious inheritance in the saints
column7: and His incomparably great power for us who believe."

column2: "*May we be brought to complete unity - especially NAMES* - to let the world know that You sent Jesus and have loved us even as You have loved Jesus."

I pray that out of His glorious riches *God may strengthen NAMES with power through His Spirit* in their inner being, so *that Christ may dwell in their hearts through faith*. And I pray that NAMES, being rooted and established in love, may have power, together with all the saints, to grasp how wide and long and high and deep is the love of Christ, and to know this love that surpasses knowledge that they may be filled to the measure of all the fullness of God.
"*Pray for NAMES that the message of the Lord may spread rapidly and be honored*. And pray that they may be delivered from wicked and evil people
column3: for not everyone has faith. But the Lord is faithful
column4: and He will *strengthen and protect NAMES from the evil one*.... May the Lord *direct their hearts into God's love and Christ's perseverance*."

column2: "And this is my prayer: *that their love may abound* more and more in knowledge and depth of insight
column3: so *that NAMES may be able to discern what is best and may be pure and blameless* until the day of Christ
column4: filled with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus Christ to the glory and praise of God."

column2: "We *ask God to fill NAMES with the knowledge of His will* through all spiritual wisdom and understanding. And we pray this in order *that NAMES may live a life worthy of the Lord* and may please Him in every way: bearing fruit in every good work
column3: growing in the knowledge of God
column4: being strengthened with all power according to His glorious might so *that they may have great endurance and patience*
column5: and joyfully giving thanks to the Father
column6: who has qualified NAMES to share in the inheritance of the saints in the kingdom of light."

column2: "May the God who gives endurance and encouragement *give us a spirit of unity among ourselves as we follow Christ Jesus*
column3: so that with one heart and mouth we (and *especially NAMES*) may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ."

column2: "Holy Father
column3: *protect us by the power of Your name* - the name You gave Jesus - so *that we may be one* as Jesus and the Father are one. I pray this *especially for NAMES*."

column2: "*Pray for NAMES that God may open a door for their message*
column3: so that they may proclaim the mystery of Christ. *Pray that they may proclaim it clearly*

column2: "May the God of hope *fill NAMES with all joy and peace* as they trust in Him
column3: so that *they may overflow with hope* by the power of the Holy Spirit.)"

column2: "May the Lord *strengthen their hearts so that NAMES will be blameless and holy* in the presence of our God and Father when our Lord Jesus comes with all His holy ones."
"*May grace and peace be multiplied to NAMES* through the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord."
"May God Himself
column4: *sanctify NAMES through and through. May their whole spirit
column5: soul and body be kept blameless* at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. The one who calls them is faithful and He will do it."

column2: "*We pray that our God may make NAMES worthy of His calling*
column3: and that by His power He may *bring to fruition their every desire for goodness* and every act prompted by their faith. We pray this so *that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in NAMES*
column5: according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ."

column2: "My prayer is not that You take NAMES out of the world but that You *protect them from the evil one*. They are not of the world
column3: even as Jesus was not of it. *Sanctify them by the truth*; Your word is truth."

column2: "*Pray for NAMES
column3: that whenever they open their mouths words may be given them* so that they will fearlessly make known the mystery of the gospel."

column2: "Now
column4: *consider Stanford and enable Your servants NAMES to speak Your word with great boldness*. Stretch out Your hand to *heal and perform miraculous signs and wonders* through the name of Your holy servant Jesus."

column2: "I pray that NAMES may *enjoy good health* and that *all may go well with them*
column3: even as their souls are prospering."

column2: "I pray that NAMES's *partnership with us in the faith* may be effective in *deepening their understanding* of *every good thing* we share for the sake of Christ."
"Lord
column3: *bless NAMES* and keep them; make Your face shine on them and *be gracious to them*; turn Your face toward them and *give them peace*."

column2: "Now may the God of peace
column3: who through the blood of the eternal covenant brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus
column4: that great Shepherd of the sheep
column5: *equip NAMES with everything good for doing His will*
column6: and may He work in them what is pleasing to Him
column8: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen."

column2: "May our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father
column3: who loved us and by His grace gave us eternal encouragement and good hope
column4: *encourage NAMES and strengthen them in every good deed and word*."

column2: "*Show NAMES your ways*
column4: *teach them your paths.* *Guide NAMES* in your truth and teach them
column5: for you are God their Savior
column6: and their hope is in you all day long."
